_header: Farewell that was my lief so dear
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 405.
_description: Humfrey Newton, his mistress gets a separation from her lover — three 8-line stanzas

BodLatMisC66.First Lines:
fare well þat was my lef so dere& fro her that loued you
                    so well…
BodLatMisC66.Last Lines:
…& now to crist I you be taketo saue & kepe in whert
                    & sance
BodLatMisC66.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “The Poems of Humphrey Newton, Esquire, 1466-1536.” 
             PMLA
         65 (1950): 249-81: 268.
